[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the BIOS configuration settings change test")

        cfg1 = SystemConfig.config_check(self.host, )
        self.validate_condition(cfg1, "Config check")

        # Copy over bios files and unarchive them
        bios_file = ('/mnt/vol/havoc/autoval/bin/'
                'leopard_fw/F06_ME_BIOS_Update_Rev06.tar.gz')
        shutil.copy(bios_file, self.resultsdir)
        os.chdir(self.resultsdir)
        self.host.localhost.run('/bin/tar xvf ' + self.resultsdir +
                '/F06_ME_BIOS_Update_Rev06.tar.gz')

        # Make SCELNX executable
        SCELNX_PATH = (self.resultsdir + '/F06_ME_BIOS_Update_Rev06/SCELNX_64')
        if(os.path.isfile(SCELNX_PATH) and
                os.access(SCELNX_PATH, os.X_OK)):
            pass
        else:
            self.host.run('chmod +x ' + SCELNX_PATH)

        # Now run SCELNX and extract the bios settings
        self.log_info("Reading original BIOS settings")
        self.host.run(SCELNX_PATH + ' /o /s ' + self.resultsdir + '/bios.out')

        # Check if security settings are properly applied
        self.log_info("Checking for Security BIOS Setting")
        result = self._check_settings(self.resultsdir + '/bios.out')
        self.validate_condition(result, "Setting Check")


    def _check_settings(self, filepath):
        i_f = open(filepath, 'r')

        settings_to_chk = [[r'Intel TXT Support', r'Enabled'],
                            [r'VMX', r'Enabled'],
                            [r'SMX', r'Enabled'],
                            [r'Intel(R) VT for Directed I/O (VT-d)', r'Enable'],
                            [r'Interrupt Remapping', r'Enabled'],
                            [r'Security Device Support', r'Enable'],
                            [r'TPM State', r'Enabled']]

        heading_re = re.compile(r'^Setup Question\s+=\s+(?P<options>.+)$')
        search_setting = ""
        start_looking = False
        found = False

        """

        The code below extract the fields associated with each BIOS setting
        and checks specifically if the option field has the right setting
        applied

        The procedure is as follows:
        1. loop until the line with "Setup Question" is found
        2. Set the start_looking to true, i.e. loop until the setting value
           is reached and checked if it is selected
        3. If selected correctly, unset start_looking and the loop
           will go back to Step 1; if not, exit the function to return false
        4. This will be done until the full file pass-thru is complete
        5. One final check to ensure all the settings are checked is added
           in the very end.

        """

        for l in i_f.readlines():
            if start_looking:
                if l.find(search_setting) != -1 and l.find(r'*[') != -1:
                    self.log_info("Setting %s Found, verified correct"
                            % search_setting)
                    start_looking = False
                elif not l.strip():
                    if not found:
                        return False

            result = heading_re.findall(l.strip())
            if len(result) > 0:
                for (option, setting) in settings_to_chk:
                    if result[0] == option:
                        self.log_info("Locate %s, start check" % option)
                        search_setting = setting
                        settings_to_chk.remove([option, setting])
                        start_looking = True
        i_f.close()

        if len(settings_to_chk) != 0:
            self.log_info("Not all fields are checked")
            return False
        else:
            self.log_info("All settings have been verified")
            return True
